member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSAttributeValueCmdlet
member.summary:
Returns a list of attribute values. Attibutes are similar to the details in a Price List API offer file. For a list of available attributes, see Offer File Definitions in the AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The name of the attribute that you want to retrieve the values for, such as volumeType.
The service code for the service whose attributes you want to retrieve. For example, if you want the retrieve an EC2 attribute, use AmazonEC2.
The maximum number of results to return in response.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

para.para: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSAttributeValueCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'AttributeValues'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSAttributeValueCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AttributeName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AttributeName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSAttributeValueCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSProductCmdlet
member.summary:
Returns a list of all products that match the filter criteria.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The list of filters that limit the returned products. only products that match all filters are returned.
The code for the service whose products you want to retrieve.
The format version that you want the response to be in.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

para.para: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSProductCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'PriceList'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSProductCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ServiceCode parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ServiceCode' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSProductCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSServiceCmdlet
member.summary:
Returns the metadata for one service or a list of the metadata for all services. Use this without a service code to get the service codes for all services. Use it with a service code, such as AmazonEC2, to get information specific to that service, such as the attribute names available for that service. For example, some of the attribute names available for EC2 are volumeType, maxIopsVolume, operation, locationType, and instanceCapacity10xlarge.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The code for the service whose information you want to retrieve, such as AmazonEC2. You can use the ServiceCode to filter the results in a GetProducts call. To retrieve a list of all services, leave this blank.
The format version that you want the response to be in.
The maximum number of results that you want returned in the response.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

para.para: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSServiceCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Services'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSServiceCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ServiceCode parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ServiceCode' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.PLS.GetPLSServiceCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
